customer_reviews.title: Fancy is overrated. Simple is underrated.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good microwave at a good price. I don't need a lot of fancy settings for different types of foods. I just want to cook a TV dinner, nuke leftovers, some soup, or a cup of coffee. I don't even need or want a clock. My only complaint is that it is difficult to read the dial settings. I wish they made those settings easier to read or added a button that could add a backlight that would go on for 10 seconds so you could read the power/timer settings.
customer_reviews.author: Sharky

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my 93 year old mother. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 93 year old mother. She was having problems reading the controls on her old microwave. This microwave is really simple to operate. Basically one knob operation. One knob sets the power, you just leave it on high and the other knob is the timer. You turn it to the proper time and it starts right away and dings when it's done.

customer_reviews.text: I purchased my original microwave back in 1979, when they didn't have all that digital stuff. It finally died. I wanted a replacement that had dials for heat setting and time. customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty good microwave but there was one issue
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good microwave but there was one issue. The glass plate didn't rotate properly. The problem was the brown triangular thing the plate sits on was too low to make proper contact with the plate. I pulled the brown triangle thing off its drive shaft (no resistance, it was loosely placed on the shaft) and I put a small piece of cardboard in the hollow shaft of the triangular brown thing as a spacer. This raised it up around 1/4 of an inch and the plate then fitted perfectly in the triangle slots. Now it works great. They most likely forgot to insert a spacer in the brown triangular thing at the factory. Anyway, it's fixed.

This unit is of good quality, and a short spin of one knob gets you cooking. Power levels are adjustable, and the size is fine for most kitchen tasks. The unit is not LOUD, but it's more than a gentle hum. I would but it again, though, since knob-based microwave ovens are hard to find.
